org.vaadin.addons.beantuplecontainer
Class BeanTupleQueryDefinition

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.addons.criteriacore.AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<javax.persistence.Tuple>
      org.vaadin.addons.beantuplecontainer.BeanTupleQueryDefinition
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition
Direct Known Subclasses:
CriteriaQueryDefinition
public abstract class BeanTupleQueryDefinition
extends AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<javax.persistence.Tuple>
implements org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition

Type-safe implementation of JPA 2.0 Tuple-based query definition.

This class uses the JPA 2.0 Criteria API to automatically infer all the information necessary to populate a container (the names of the properties, their sorting, etc.)

The query returns a Tuple of one or more entities and computed expressions. The query defines all the attributes of each of the entities as nested propertyIds, so a container using this query will consider them present. The BeanTupleItem used in the BeanTupleContainer maps the nested properties to entity fields, and in this way allows properties to be edited.

The following example shows a query that can be used to define a container: it returns a tuple of entities (through the multiselect() call), and defines conditions through a where() call.

The other methods in this class will examine the resulting object structure to retrieve the information necessary to list the properties, define sorting, and so on.

protected Root<?> defineQuery( 
        CriteriaBuilder cb,
        CriteriaQuery cq) {

    // FROM task JOIN PERSON 
    Root<Person> person = (Root<Person>) cq.from(Person.class);
    task = person.join(Person_.tasks); 

    // SELECT task as Task, person as Person, ... 
    cq.multiselect(task,person);

    // WHERE t.name LIKE "..."    
    cq.where(
        cb.like(
            task.get(Task_.name), // t.name
            "some string%")  // sql "like" pattern to be matched
        );
    }

    return task; // for EclipseLink you must return the rightmost joined entity.
}
}

jflamy

Field Detail

countingExpressionMap

protected Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> countingExpressionMap
Map from a property name to the expression that is used to set the property. Each item property is retrieved by an expression in a CriteriaQuery.multiselect(List) In order to be able to sort, we need to create an Order using that expression, so we must memorize the correspondence between propertyIds and the expression that fetch item properties for that id.

selectExpressionMap

protected Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> selectExpressionMap
The maps cannot be shared between the two queries.

See Also:

getSelectQuery

public javax.persistence.TypedQuery<javax.persistence.Tuple> getSelectQuery()
Description copied from class: AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition
This method adds the ordering and the parameters on a query definition. AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition.defineQuery(CriteriaBuilder, CriteriaQuery) creates the portion of the query that is shared between counting and retrieving. This method returns a runnable query by adding the ordering and setting the parameters.

Specified by:
getSelectQuery in class AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<javax.persistence.Tuple>
Returns:
a query with the applicable sorting options applied

defineCountingQuery

protected javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<Object> defineCountingQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder criteriaBuilder,
                                                                               javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<javax.persistence.Tuple> tupleQuery,
                                                                               javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager)
Method used to override the default counting. By default the container will generate a count by manipulating the select query. Use this method if a more efficient way to get the count exists (or if the JPA implementation is broken) e.g. Hibernate with @IdClass)

Parameters:
criteriaBuilder - the criteriaBuilder
tupleQuery - the resulting query
entityManager - the entityManager to use
Returns:
a counting query, ready to run.

defineQuery

protected abstract javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> defineQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder criteriaBuilder,
                                                                  javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> tupleQuery)
Define a query that fetches a tuple of one or more entities.

Note that defineQuery must always use CriteriaQuery.multiselect(Selection...) because a tuple is expected.

Specified by:
defineQuery in class AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<javax.persistence.Tuple>
Parameters:
criteriaBuilder - the CriteriaBuilder used to define the from, where and select
tupleQuery - the CriteriaQuery to build the tuples,
Returns:
a root of the query (used for counting the lines returned)

addPropertyForComputedValue

protected javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?> addPropertyForComputedValue(Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> expressionMap,
                                                                               String propertyId,
                                                                               javax.persistence.criteria.Selection<?> selection,
                                                                               boolean defineProperties)
Define the expression required to retrieve a column. The entity field will be retrieved as a tuple element. In order to enable sorting, we must memorize the query expression used to retrieve each field. An alias is defined on the expression.

Parameters:
expressionMap - where to remember the mapping
propertyId - the desired property id. An alias will be defined.
selection - the root or join from which the desired column will be fetched
defineProperties - define properties for the container
Returns:
an expression that can be used in JPA order()

addPropertyForAttribute

protected javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?> addPropertyForAttribute(Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> expressionMap,
                                                                           String propertyId,
                                                                           javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> path,
                                                                           javax.persistence.metamodel.SingularAttribute<?,?> column,
                                                                           boolean defineProperties)
Define the expression required to retrieve an item property. The entity field will be retrieved as a tuple element. In order to enable sorting, we must memorize the query expression used to retrieve each field. This version is used when the propertyId must differ from the field name in the Entity (for example, when two fields have the same name, and aliases must be used, this method ensures that the aliases are defined consistently with the propertyId).

Parameters:
expressionMap - where to remember the mapping
propertyId - the property identifier in the items that will be constructed
path - the root or join from which the desired column will be fetched
column - the expression used to get the desired column in the query results
defineProperties - define the property for the container
Returns:
an expression that can be used in JPA order()

addPropertyForExpression

protected void addPropertyForExpression(Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> expressionMap,
                                        Object propertyId,
                                        javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?> expression,
                                        boolean defineProperties)
Helper routine to add a property.

Parameters:
expressionMap - where to remember the mapping
propertyId - the property Id
expression - the expression that fetches the value for propertyId
defineProperties - define the property for the container

addEntityProperties

protected void addEntityProperties(Map<Object,javax.persistence.criteria.Expression<?>> expressionMap,
                                   javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> entityPath,
                                   boolean defineProperties)
Add an entity to the list of selections. Create Expression objects for each of the attributes of the entity, so that sorting is possible on the attributes. Ensure that an alias is present on the selection, if not, use the type as alias

Parameters:
expressionMap - where to remember the mappings
entityPath - path (Root or Join) that designates an entity
defineProperties - define properties for the container

                                    javax.persistence.criteria.Path<?> entityPath,
                                    boolean defineProperties)
If needed, add a property for the entity itself (if entity Person is part of the resulting tuple, then Person can be used to get the whole entity).

Parameters:

entityPath - path (Root or Join) that designates an entity
defineProperties - define properties for the container

                                   javax.persistence.criteria.Selection<?> selection,
                                   boolean defineProperties)
Add a computed expression to the list of selections. Remember the Expression so that sorting is possible on the attributes. Ensure that an alias is present on the selection.

Parameters:
expressionMap - where to remember the mapping
selection - alias for an Expression for a computed value
defineProperties - where to remember the mapping
